I personally love being the one to give BUT I'm very fem most women I date are on the more androgynous side-therefor it's usually a giant power struggle haha. That being said, there are MANY women who ONLY give are uncomfortable receiving. This would be a good dynamic for you.

I think a common misconception is that if a proper diagnosis is made, the corresponding prescriptions won't produce negative side effects that's simply not true... Someone can definitely have ADD still experience adverse effects of a stimulant at a low dose. For example, adderall is mostly effective for me-though it does seem to trigger my already pre-existing insomnia/disordered eating. BUT it's much less dangerous for me than Vyvanse for some reason. Everyone's different our bodies just react differently
